author: Mene Ukueberuwa
title: A Song of Spiritual Awakening
text:
Arguably the most influential musician in history, Johann Sebastian Bach is not usually asked to share credit for his works. But in his 1731 cantata, “Wachet auf, ruft uns die Stimme,” the German composer’s music finished an already sublime composition supplied by a predecessor, the hymnist and preacher Philipp Nicolai. The sum of the two men’s efforts is more than a feast for the ears. In both its tune and its text, the cantata—known in English as “Sleepers Wake”—describes the ultimate feast: the fulfillment of all human hope.
Like...
